My Certificates

Welcome to my digital trophy cabinet "Yes, I actually did that." This is where my collection of shiny badges and fancy titles lives— proof that I’ve clicked Next Lesson more times than I care to admit. These certifications cover everything and each one tells a story — mostly of me battling video lectures, dodging the mcq quizzes, and occasionally yelling at my screen, “WHY WON’T YOU RUN?!” . Think of this section as my résumé’s cooler, funnier cousin—less formal, more "look what I can do!" version. Browse away, and remember: behind every certificate is a lot of tea and questionable life choices. Take a look, and don't be shy to ask if I accept tips in snacks or compliments!

2025 Ongoing

Automated Expense Tracker

Preview Linkedin
Google Forms
Google Sheets
Make.com
Open AI

My attempt at developing an automated experience by building an expense tracking system using Google Forms, Google Sheets, and Make.com. The system collects user inputs using Google forms ( I had to start somewhere ) , categorizes expenses, sends email notifications, and provides summaries through an email. I have a lot to do and this is an ongoing certificate. Check out the LinkedIn certificate for more details.

2024 - 2025 Ongoing

Real Time Threat Detection System

Preview LinkedIn
Python
Yolo v8
CNN
Deep Learning

The Major certificate I'm developing in my College focuses on real-time threat detection using YOLO v8 and Convolutional Neural Networks. This deep learning certificate aims to identify potential security risks through video analysis, with a specific focus on detecting suspicious behavior and potential threats. Currently in development, this system will integrate with existing security infrastructure to provide automated alerts and monitoring capabilities.
